result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:33 PM Defendant Terence D. Blackmon in court.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Terence D. Blackmon.  Attorney (Atty) Noel A Lawrence appeared by video for State of Wisconsin - DOJ. for case 19CF259.  
Assistant District Attorney (ADA)  Pfeil is present for the other cases 2020CF000013, 2021CF000009, 2021CF000010, 2021CF000014, 2021CF000015, 2021CF000274, 2021CF000351, 2021CF000469, 2022CF000131, 2022CF000143, and 2022CF000151. These cases are set for pretrial on 12-19-2023.

Status hearing on November 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Judge Patricia Baker assigned
Gary Kryshak.

10:00 AM Defendant Terence D. Blackmon in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases 20CF13, 2021CF000009, 2021CF000010, 2021CF000014, 2021CF000015, 2021CF000274, 2021CF000351, 2021CF000469, 2022CF000131, 2022CF000143, 2022CF000151.  ADA Jambois informs the court that Atty Kryshak is willing to be court appointed.  Attorney (Atty) Gary Kryshak is now in court.
BY THE COURT: Court is willing to appoint Atty Kryshak.
Atty Kryshak will need time to consider this appointment.
Parties to contact the Judge's JA to schedule for a new status date.
Judge will deal with the motion on 21CF469 when the requester is present at a hearing.
Bond will continue.
Status Report from JusticePoint dated 10/20/22
Status Report from JusticePoint dated 10/07/22
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:22 a.m.  Defendant Terence D. Blackmon in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are:   2020CF000013, 2021CF000009, 2021CF000010, 2021CF000014, 2021CF000015, 2021CF000274, 2021CF000351, 2021CF000469, 2022CF000131, 2022CF000143 and 2022CF000151. 

ADA Jambois calls the case and states the appearances.
Judge Wolf questions the defendant.
Defendant responds and indicates that the public defender's office has not yet assigned an attorney.
Defendant states that if he did not have counsel by his next hearing on 10/10 that Judge Baker would then assign counsel.
ADA Jambois comes up and speaks directly into the phone to Judge Wolf.
Court questions when the defendant's next hearing is and he indicates that it is on 10/10/22 @ 10:00 a.m.  
Judge Wolf will set this again for another status conference on 10/24/22 and hopefully he will have counsel by then  
Defendant wishes to speak on another matter; Judge Wolf will not hear him as of today's date.

BY THE COURT: 
Status Conference re-scheduled.
Mandatory Appearance for the defendant.

**No Court Reporter as was a Status Conference to Determine if the Defendant has Counsel to Represent him**

Day Report Program Status Report - Condition of Bond. Filed by JusticePoint - C Amundson.

3:01 PM Defendant Terence D. Blackmon appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Allen Huesmann Aty appeared by video for Terence D. Blackmon.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases 20CF13, 2021CF000009, 2021CF000010, 2021CF000014, 2021CF000015, 2021CF000274, 2021CF000351, 2021CF000469, 2022CF000131, 2022CF000143, and 2022CF000151.
Motions for revoking bond, motion for joinder, and a motion to withdraw as counsel have been filed.
ADA Jambois makes statements in support of his motion for revoking or forfeiting bond. 
Atty Huesmann makes statements opposing revoking or forfeiting bond.
BY THE COURT:  Motion to revoke bond is denied all bonds remain the same on each case.
Motion to withdraw counsel:
Court questions the Defendant and Atty Huesmann.
BY THE COURT: Motion for Atty Huesmann to withdraw is granted.
Motion for joinder will be addressed with new counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Status Report from JusticePoint dated 06/10/22
Pre-trial conference on July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant received copies of informations.
Defendant waives reading of informations. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

Atty Huesmann makes bond arguments to the court.  Asks that the no contact condition be no abusive contact. 
Atty Jambois makes arguments in opposition to the request.  
Court reviews the bonds in the files.  

BY THE COURT:  Court does not modify the bond at this time as it was modified in March and then there were new charges and he is not maintaining the testing reporting requirements.  If that changes, can be reviewed in the future.

3:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Robert J Jambois in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Terence D. Blackmon appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Allen Huesmann Aty appeared by video for Terence D. Blackmon. 
All files heard: 22CF131, 22CF143, 22CF151

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing and written waivers were submitted. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:41 PM Defendant Terence D. Blackmon in court.  Atty Mark Huesmann appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF143 and 22CF151.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.

this request.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
FCC does not address bond today.
Atty Huesmann will be allowed to appear via ZOOM.

1:16 PM Defendant Terence Blackmon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Terence Blackmon. 

ADA  Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
